newsitem.title: UK: Rolls-Royce Plc bags 11 mln stg Dutch order.
newsitem.headline: Rolls-Royce Plc bags 11 mln stg Dutch order.

text.p: British engineering group Rolls-Royce Plc said on Tuesday the Royal Netherlands Navy placed its second 11 million stg order in a year for four Spey SMI1C engines.
Rolls-Royce will begin delivery next year of the engines plus another four that were previously ordered.
The engines will be used to power air defence frigates, the company said.
Rolls-Royce also said Caillard, its French-based materials handling company, had won its third order in China, bringing its total order value in that country to almost $20 million.
Caillard's latest order involved supplying coal handling equipment for the Yangzhou power plant in Jiangsu province. The value of this order was not given.
